title: 105_hr3143
content: The Act titled "Comprehensive Holocaust Accountability in Insurance Measure" prohibits certain foreign insurance companies. The Act titled "Comprehensive Holocaust Accountability in Insurance Measure" prohibits specific foreign insurance companies from conducting business in the United States unless they disclose financial dealings with individuals on Holocaust survivor lists. The Act requires certain foreign insurance companies to disclose financial dealings with Holocaust survivors to a designated office in the Department of Justice for public access. TITLE II--PROVISIONS APPLICABLE TO UNITED STATES BANKING INSTITUTIONS: LIMITATION ON INSURED DEPOSITORY INSTITUTIONS. Prohibition on transactions with certain insurance companies or their affiliates by insured depository institutions under the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. The Comprehensive Holocaust Accountability in Insurance Measure prohibits insured depository institutions from engaging in transactions with certain foreign insurance companies or their affiliates, unless the company complies with disclosure requirements. An exception allows affiliates of the insurance company to pay dividends or invest capital in the institution. The Comprehensive Holocaust Accountability in Insurance Measure prohibits insured depository institutions from transactions with certain foreign insurance companies or affiliates unless they comply with disclosure requirements. An exception allows affiliates to pay dividends or invest in the institution, subject to regulations set by the Attorney General or Federal banking agency. SEC. 202. LIMITATION ON UNINSURED BRANCHES, AGENCIES, AND COMMERCIAL LENDING COMPANY AFFILIATES OF FOREIGN BANKS. Section 7 of the International Banking Act of 1978 is amended to prohibit certain transactions with foreign insurance companies or their affiliates. This includes deposit acceptance, payment services, credit balances, loans, and other financial activities. The International Banking Act of 1978 is amended to restrict transactions with foreign insurance companies or their affiliates, prohibiting certain financial activities. Additionally, a limited exception is provided for affiliates of foreign insurance companies regarding dividends and capital investments.
